alert.note: Alert for Greene (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL MONROE... SOUTHWESTERN GREENE...WETZEL...MARSHALL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 AM EDT... At 911 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Powhatan Point, or 7 miles northeast of New Martinsville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Martinsville, Pine Grove, Hundred, Jacksonburg, Clarington, Smithfield, Wileyville, Grove Oak, Proctor, Woodlands, Big Run, and Reader. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
